history.content: I think unless the policy has changed recently you must complete two semesters before you can switch majors (I just switched majors from mechE to EECS last semester as a second semester freshman). If you have any questions it might be best to reach out to your College of Engineering adviser as they will be directly handling your application and know when you can apply/what requirements that you will have to meet in order to be approved.

I was wondering if I would be able to change my major from nuclear engineering to EECS after my first semester as an incoming freshman. I would be taking Math 53, CS 61A, and Physics 7A my first semester. I noticed on a different post about changing majors to EECS that "Students who have completed N semesters, for N = 1, 2, 3, or 4, must have completed at least N of EE 20, EE 40, EE 16A, EE 16B, CS61A, CS61B, CS61C, CS 70." WIth N = 1, does that mean it is possible to change my major after the first semester? I have also heard it takes two semesters minimum so I am not so sure. Thanks.
history.subject: Possible to change major to EECS after first semester?
